Metadata: The interface of natural product chemistry and biology

"Marine Biotechnology in the Twenty-First Century: Problems, Promise and Products," pp. 61-64, National Academy Press, Washington DC, 2002. Committee on Marine Biotechnology, Biomedical Applications of Marine Natural Products, Ocean Studies Board, Board on Life Sciences, Division on Earth and Life Studies, National Research Council.

Natural chemical constituents of living organisms called natural products have historically been used to treat human infections and diseases. This brief encyclopedic report describes how techniques in molecular biology have merged with those in natural products chemistry to facilitate the generation of natural products through combinatorial biosynthesis, metabolic engineering, and potentially, biosynthesis of uncultured microorganisms.
